title: Historian on a photograph workers - effect

content.description:
“In August 1865, the photographer Marcus Ormsbee... took a formal portrait of several groups of craft workers in their different shops.... At the center of the photograph, at Outcault’s carpentry shop, stands the conventional artisan trio of master, journeyman, and apprentice, still at the heart of the city’s workshop world—yet class differences mark these craftsmen’s every feature.... Brooding above everyone, a new brick manufactory seals off its employees from the street and from public view. Small shop and large enterprise converge; New York remains a blend of old and new.”

Sean Wilentz, historian, Chants Democratic, 1984
content.question: The conditions described in the excerpt most directly contributed to the

choices.label: decrease in tariffs for manufactured goods
growth of an organized labor movement
expansion of government regulation of industry
loss of class distinctions in the United States

content.answer: growth of an organized labor movement

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
